title.value: A Halfspace-Mass Depth-Based Method for Adversarial Attack Detection
title.justification: Title of the paper is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: A Halfspace-Mass Depth-Based Method for Adversarial Attack Detection

extractions.description: This paper introduces HAMPER, a method for detecting adversarial examples in machine learning models using halfspace-mass depth, a concept from statistics that offers center-outward ordering of data points. The paper demonstrates HAMPER's effectiveness across various benchmark datasets and compares it with state-of-the-art methods.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and numerical evaluations of the proposed method (HAMPER) across various adversarial attacks and datasets.
type.quote: We evaluate HAMPER in the context of supervised adversarial attacks detection across four benchmark datasets. Overall, we empirically show that HAMPER consistently outperforms SOTA methods.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on detecting adversarial attacks in machine learning models.
name.quote: Detecting these attacks is thus crucial to build reliable algorithms and has received increasing attention in the last few years.

name.justification: The evaluations include datasets commonly used in computer vision tasks, such as CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100.
name.quote: We extensively evaluate HAMPER's performance across popular attack strategies and computer vision benchmark datasets (e.g., SVHN, CIFAR10, and CIFAR100).

name.justification: Adversarial detection is compared and related to anomaly detection within the paper.
name.quote: Adversarial detection can be related to the anomaly detection problem. Indeed, anomaly detection aims to identify abnormal observations without previously knowing them, possibly including adversarial attacks.

name.justification: The paper introduces HAMPER as the primary method for adversarial attack detection.
name.quote: In this paper, we introduce the HalfspAce Mass dePth dEtectoR (HAMPER), a new method to detect adversarial examples by leveraging the concept of data depths.

is_contributed.justification: HAMPER is introduced in the paper, making it a direct contribution to the research field.
is_contributed.quote: In this paper, we introduce the HalfspAce Mass dePth dEtectoR (HAMPER), a new method to detect adversarial examples by leveraging the concept of data depths.

is_executed.justification: The model is evaluated on various datasets with empirical results presented.
is_executed.quote: We extensively evaluate HAMPER's performance across popular attack strategies and computer vision benchmark datasets.

is_compared.justification: HAMPER is compared with state-of-the-art adversarial detection methods within the paper.
is_compared.quote: Overall, we empirically show that HAMPER consistently outperforms SOTA methods.

referenced_paper_title.value: A Halfspace-Mass Depth-Based Method for Adversarial Attack Detection
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper is self-contained and introduces HAMPER without referencing an external paper for this specific model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In this paper, we introduce the HalfspAce Mass dePth dEtectoR (HAMPER)...

name.justification: SVHN is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for evaluating HAMPER.
name.quote: In particular, the gains are 13.1% (29.0%) in terms of AUROC↑ (resp. FPR ↓95% ) on SVHN.

referenced_paper_title.value: Reading Digits in Natural Images with Unsupervised Feature Learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: SVHN dataset is commonly referenced to this standard research paper in the literature.

name.justification: PyTorch is typically used for implementing and training deep learning models, which is likely the case for HAMPER given the context.

referenced_paper_title.justification: PyTorch is a widely recognized library often cited in implementations of deep learning methods.
